description.narrative: Capacity at national and sub-national level developed for multi-dimensional education planning and budgeting and for tracking of and response to out-of-school children with a special focus on adolescent girls, which contributes to Education In Emergencies, Education â€“ General, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Equity â€“ Focus On Girls' And Inclusive Education, Learning And Child-Friendly Schools, Learning Outcomes, Skills Development. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Improved equitable primary school access and retention

title.narrative: Capacity at national and sub-national level developed for multi-dimensional education planning and budgeting and for tracking ofand response to out-of-school children with a special focus on adolescent girls

description.narrative: Achievements include the approved national gender strategy and associated implementation plans for Tete and Zambezia. Trainings occurred on preventing/reporting school-based sexual abuse, decentralized planning processes, and the integration of cross-cutting issues into the primary curriculum. UNICEF also supported a manual for school councils on school-based emergency preparedness and response. | Status:Met | As-of Date:20/12/2016

title.narrative: Number of education functionaries trained on planning and data collection and use in Tete and Zambezia

actual.value: 2016:115POEMA (Planning, Budgeting, Execution, Monitoring and Evaluation): 61 Education Officers (28 in Tete and 33 in Zambezia)Evidence-based Planning: 54 Education Officers (36 in Tete and 18 in Zambezia)

title.narrative: Functional school management committees at primary and secondary level [score]

actual.value: 2017:In 2016, the Ministry of Education and Human Development completed roll-out of the national programme on building capacity of school councils.
2016:Yes. Prevention of and preparedness to natural disaster is part of the science subject
2016:Yes. School-based emergency preparedness and early response manual is finalized and will be rolled out after second round of piloting in Q2 2017.
